intro: Blitum litwinowii, commonly known as the Litwinow's bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with distinctive four-petaled flowers. The plant is characterized by its small, rounded leaves and pods that resemble bladders, giving it its common name. It typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in sagebrush habitats. Blitum litwinowii is an annual or biennial plant that blooms in the spring and early summer.
